briefTitle: Intravenous Nutrition in Hospitalized Patients: Comparison of Two Oils
officialTitle: Parenteral Nutrition in Hospitalized Patients: Comparison of Two Commercially Available Lipid Emulsions

protocolDocument.label: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

eligibilityCriteria.criteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Patients 18 years or older

  * Patients with PN during their hospitalization
  * Patients hospitalized in medical, surgical or ICU wards
  * Signed informed consent either from the patient, their legally authorized representative or a direct family member

Exclusion Criteria:

* â€¢ Patients without PN during their hospitalization

primary.description: prealbumin is an hepatic protein that is used in the diagnosis of malnutrition. It has a short half-life so any changes in nutritional status can rapidly be represented by prealbumin levels.

secondary.description: Length of stay in the hospital and ICU will be recorded for 1 year
secondary.timeFrame: participants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay up to one year

secondary.description: We will follow the patients from the day of admission until the day of discharge and record the mortality for 1 year
secondary.timeFrame: participantes will be followed for the duration of hospital stay for up to 1 year

secondary.description: we will record the infections the patients develop during PN until one week after PN for 1 year
secondary.timeFrame: until one week post-PN up to 1 year

secondary.description: We will measure hand grip strength at baseline (day0) and at day 10 of PN. This is a test that measures the strength of the hand and forearm muscles and is often used as a general test of strength
secondary.timeFrame: at baseline (day 0) and day 10 of PN

secondary.description: This is a rough indicator of body fat

secondary.measure: Subjective Global Assessment (SGA): Number Who Improved
secondary.description: is a bedside method that assesses the risk of malnutrition and identifies which patient will benefit best from nutrition support

secondary.measure: Change in High Sensitivity C-reactive Protein (Hs-CRP)
secondary.description: hs-CRP is a marker of inflammation, we will measure this parameter at baseline and after 10 days of PN

secondary.measure: Red Blood Cell Fatty Acid Composition: Linoleic
secondary.description: Red blood cell fatty acid composition, particularly the essential fatty acids (linoleic acid and alpha-linolenic acid) will be measured to assess presence/absence of essential fatty acid deficiency
